title: Ticket #3207: Jobs in scheduler universe ignore OnExitRemove
description:
Jobs in scheduler universe ignore OnExitRemove, and go directly to "Completed" state, disregarding policy expressions.

A job running under scheduler universe would improperly be marked as "Completed", instead of using the OnExitRemove attribute to decide if it should leave the queue. The message below is a symptom of this bug. To be explicit, the OnExitRemove expression for condor_dagman reads 

on_exit_remove  = ( ExitSignal =?= 11 || (ExitCode =!= UNDEFINED && ExitCode >=0 && ExitCode <= 2))
Thus, when condor_dagman exits with status 3, the schedd should move it to "Idle" state and restart it. But this was not happening because the schedd was moving it to "Completed" state, rather than "Idle". All scheduler jobs that exited would be marked as "Completed" state, regardless of the OnExitRemove expression. 

Begin forwarded message:

From: John Veitch <johnv@nikhef.nl>
Subject: [DASWG] Re: condor_schedd issue at LHO

Hi Dan, Vladimir,

This also happened to my running DAGs, which will require some manual
intervention to figure out how to restart/resume without losing work.
If you need to restart condor again, would it be possible to kill the condor
job that is running the DAG beforehand, so that it writes out a rescue DAG?

Cheers,
John

1st thought: check for the existence of a .lock file in the directory where DAGMan is running; if it exists, DAGMan will go into recovery mode and "catch up" to the running jobs. In which case, this is simply an unhelpful message in the dagman.out file and everything is fine.
